comments.body: I think this flag might be [confusing](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/conda-forge/staged-recipes/build/1.0.3328/job/9fmtgpv3qibeakgg#L330) it.

The error says that it can't recognize generator `-Wno-dev`, since cmake expects the first argument to be `-G{generator_name_here}` and its left out.

Wait, no, that's an appveyor link, and this comment is on build.sh
Ack, sorry, I meant to put that comment in the `bld.bat`. Have now added it up there.
Could we try using the `toolchain`? Please see this PR ( https://github.com/conda-forge/thrift-cpp-feedstock/pull/4 ) for and example of how to do this.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@
BUILD_CONFIG=Release

if [ `uname` == Linux ]; then
    # FIXME refactor to reuse the python name (e.g. python3.5m)

comments.body:
Yeah, this is fun. I'm ok with leaving it in here for now. Though I would recommend trying to get this into CMake somehow.

I tried to use CMake's "FindPython*" and got frustrated. So, I wrote [my own](https://github.com/nanshe-org/rank_filter/blob/94b783fbaf20c853b1bec1b64ecfdbaea5d7fb1a/cmake/modules/FindPYTHON.cmake). Feel free to take it if it helps. Basically it uses the Python interpreter to find out all of this information. Though I haven't tried it on Windows; so, I don't know if it works there or not.
